intro: Melampyrum variegatum, commonly known as the variable touch-me-not, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its striking, bi-colored flowers that typically feature red and yellow hues, which attract pollinators such as bees and flies. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy and can vary in size depending on environmental conditions. It thrives in moist, shaded habitats, such as woodlands and stream banks, across parts of Europe and Asia. Melampyrum variegatum is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
